Enum CardBrand

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultMaxLengthWithSpaces

        public int getDefaultMaxLengthWithSpaces()

      • getMaxCvcLength

        public int getMaxCvcLength()

      • isValidCardNumberLength

        public boolean isValidCardNumberLength(java.lang.String cardNumber)

        Checks to see whether the input number is of the correct length, given the assumed brand of the card. This function does not perform a Luhn check.

        Parameters:
        cardNumber - the card number with no spaces or dashes
        Returns:
        true if the card number is the correct length for the assumed brand

      • isValidCvc

        public boolean isValidCvc(java.lang.String cvc)

      • isMaxCvc

        public boolean isMaxCvc(java.lang.String cvcText)

      • getMaxLengthForCardNumber

        public int getMaxLengthForCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)

        If the enum CardBrand has variants, and the cardNumber starts with one of the variant prefixes, return the length for that variant. Otherwise, return defaultMaxLength.

        Note: currently only CardBrand.DinersClub has variants

        See Also:
        enum CardBrand

      • getMaxLengthWithSpacesForCardNumber

        public int getMaxLengthWithSpacesForCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)

      • getSpacePositionsForCardNumber

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getSpacePositionsForCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)

        If the enum CardBrand has variants, and the cardNumber starts with one of the variant prefixes, return the length for that variant. Otherwise, return defaultMaxLength.

        Note: currently only CardBrand.DinersClub has variants

        See Also:
        enum CardBrand

      • formatNumber

        public java.lang.String formatNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)

        Format a number according to brand requirements.

        e.g. "4242424242424242" will return "4242 4242 4242 4242"

      • groupNumber

        public java.lang.String[] groupNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)

        Separates a card number according to the brand requirements, including prefixes of card numbers, so that the groups can be easily displayed if the user is typing them in. Note that this does not verify that the card number is valid, or even that it is a number.

        e.g. "4242424242424242" will return ["4242", "4242", "4242", "4242"]

        Parameters:
        cardNumber - the raw card number
        Returns:
        an array of strings with the number groups, in order. If the number is not complete, some of the array entries may be null.

      • getCode

        public java.lang.String getCode()

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getCvcLength()

        Accepted CVC lengths

      • getDefaultMaxLength

        public int getDefaultMaxLength()

        The default max length when the card number is formatted without spaces (e.g. "4242424242424242")

        Note that CardBrand.DinersClub's max length depends on the BIN (e.g. card number prefix). In the case of a CardBrand.DinersClub card, use CardBrand.getMaxLengthForCardNumber.

        See Also:
        CardBrand.getMaxLengthForCardNumber

      • getPattern

        public java.util.regex.Pattern getPattern()

        Based on

        Issuer identification number table

        See Also:
        Issuer identification number table

      • getDefaultSpacePositions

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getDefaultSpacePositions()

        The position of spaces in a formatted card number.

        For example, "4242424242424242" isformatted to "4242 4242 4242 4242".
